intro: Terminalia megalocarpa, commonly known as the African mango tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and yellowish flowers. Its bark and leaves have also been used in traditional medicine for various health purposes. The plant is well adapted to dry climates and plays an important role in local ecosystems.
